title: Base Quickstart Overview
description: A high-level introduction to Base, what itʼs all about, and how this documentation is structured to help you build on Coinbaseʼs Layer 2

title: What is Base?
description: The origin story of Base, its purpose in the Ethereum scaling ecosystem, and how it leverages the OP Stack to offer fast, low-cost transactions.

title: Key Concepts: Ethereum + OP Stack
description: The fundamental ideas behind Base, including how it inherits security from Ethereum and how transactions are processed via the Optimistic Rollup architecture.

title: Performance & Costs on Base
description: An overview of Baseʼs throughput, transaction latency, and expected gas costs compared to Ethereum mainnet—essential for planning dApp user experience.

title: Why Build on Base?
description: The key benefits (affordability, developer tooling, and ecosystem support) of choosing Base for your next decentralized application.

title: Path to Decentralization
description: Coinbaseʼs plan for progressively decentralizing the network, including how Base aims to become more community-governed over time.

title: Bridging to Base: Overview
description: The basics of bridging from Ethereum mainnet to Base, important considerations like fees, finality times, and how bridging works under the hood.

title: How to Use the Base Bridge
description: Step-by-step instructions for transferring ETH or other tokens from Ethereum to Base, plus troubleshooting common bridging errors.

title: Building on Base: Developer Overview
description: A one-stop overview of all the tools, frameworks, and relevant resources (like Hardhat, Foundry, or Ethers.js) youʼll need to start writing and deploying contracts on Base.

title: NFT Guide for Base
description: How to deploy ERC-721 or ERC-1155 tokens on Base, handle metadata, and integrate with NFT tooling or marketplaces that support L2 networks.

title: Security Model & Best Practices
description: The unique security considerations for L2 rollups, bridging risk, and recommended best practices for secure contract development on Base.

title: Optimism (OP) Stack Fundamentals
description: How Base is built atop the OP Stack from Optimism, reusing core components for consensus, execution, and bridging.

title: Gas & Fees on Base
description: The cost structure for transactions, tips for optimizing gas usage, and how to calculate user fees so you can budget your dAppʼs operational expenses.

title: Base Ecosystem & Partners
description: The growing landscape of wallets, bridges, oracles, and other infrastructure providers that are building on or integrating with Base.

title: Cross-Chain Messaging on Base
description: The basics of sending messages between Ethereum and Base or other L2s, plus guidance on cross-chain contract calls and data passing.

title: Deploy a Simple Token (ERC-20)
description: Walkthrough for compiling and deploying an ERC-20 contract, plus a sample Hardhat config tailored for Base.

title: Deploy an NFT (ERC-721)
description: Step-by-step instructions for creating and deploying an ERC-721 NFT, including code snippets and recommended frameworks.

title: Hardhat + Base Configuration
description: How to configure Hardhatʼs network settings for Base, properly set up deployment scripts, and verify contracts on supported explorers.

title: Foundry + Base Configuration
description: Setting up Foundry for Base (forge, cast, anvil), writing tests that run against the Base testnet, and recommended cheat codes or plugins.

title: Ethers.js on Base
description: Basic examples of connecting Ethers.js to a Base provider, sending transactions, reading contract data, and managing private keys/wallets.

title: Full-Stack dApp Example
description: An end-to-end example—smart contract, front-end integration (React or Next.js), and deployment to Base testnet.

title: Using Block Explorers for Base
description: Which block explorers support Base, how to verify your contracts, and how to debug transaction failures or logs on L2.

title: Security Audits & Recommendations
description: Guidance on the audit process for projects building on Base, known vulnerabilities, and how to handle bridging or L2-specific security pitfalls.

title: Example Projects & Templates
description: Pre-built repositories, code snippets, and scaffolds to jumpstart development (e.g., Hardhat boilerplates, Foundry templates, dApp front-end frameworks).

title: Launching Your dApp on Base Mainnet
description: Final best practices for releasing your project into production on Base mainnet—ensuring contract verifications, bridging liquidity, and user experience optimizations.
